reviews.title: First time buying
reviews.review_text: this bundle and I will be buying these again because, most were ripe, or close to ripe compared to buying the single avocados (which none of 6 were ripe and took several days to ripen). 1 and 2 days with a banana in a cardboard box (yes, a cardboard box taped shut down the main seam works just as good as a paper bag, and, fits a banana better than a bag does) and they'll all be ripe to use. I like the smaller ones because I can better judge how many to cut open for my use. It seems that with the larger ones I always have a half to much, and then have to refrigerate a half.

I love the size because it peels perfectly well and they are always perfect. After I take the number I need and after one or two days the avocados are perfect. So, I just peel it and put it on top of a bagel or muffin and it's just right to eat it. perfection. ❤️

It often happens that none of the avocados are ripe when they first are delivered so its a good idea to order ahead so you have a few for the next several days. When they start to ripen ,place them in the refrigerator in water enough to cover them in a deep container.

reviews.title: choose wisely
reviews.review_text: 1st! upon chosen You have to feel is of the avocado carefully. You can't grab and throw it in your cart!? You have feel it out and Don't have other items around it because you will dent it and when You do cut it? Bruised! Remember that the avocado's are in a pile, on top of each other. If you're Not sure, buy them individually. I personally take my own time and carefully feeling each one of them there's 4? feel the naval end of the avocado to tell if its ready. I take the ones that are hard that way You can keep an eye on it. And many of times it's ripe ready to eat. I find it affordable and we make sandwiches, chopped and over toss greens, omelettes. I have it in slices in a container for when in the middle of the night going back to sleep?? I'll munch on it and Yes! You can put chocolate on it, DARK chocolate, have fun.

These avacados are usually very firm %26 good. But I recently ordered some and they were too too ripe . they had to be used right away or I would have had to throw all of them away like I had to with 2 of them from that order. usually they are really good and still firm. I MIGHT order them again.

reviews.title: Rotten avocados from Colombia
reviews.review_text: I've received rotten avocados the past two times I've had them delivered from Walmart. I can't believe they sell them or that the grocers think this is okay. I also noticed that the past two times they've been from Colombia and had been packaged about 3 weeks prior. No wonder they were rotten. Walmart, please go back to avocados from Mexico or California! No doubt this is a tariff related casualty!! Thankfully I was refunded my money.

reviews.title: Bed avocado hass from Colombia
reviews.review_text: The avocados I received this last time are from Colombia, they never ripen no matter what, if any of them shows is ripe, you cut it and is rotten. Do not recommending them. Is not the first time they delivered from this country, they end up In the trash. The best avocado hass are from Mexico.

Of the 5 avocados I got only small amounts of good pulp from each one. So maybe altogether 1 avocado total. They all had dark areas and black lines in them. The ones I ordered the last time were the also the same Before that the avocados were very good and creamy.

reviews.title: Disappointed with the Quality of Delivered Avocado
reviews.review_text: I ordered avocados through delivery, and unfortunately, they arrived in very poor condition. When I cut them open, they were completely spoiled inside and not edible at all. It's disappointing, as I was hoping for fresh produce. I would recommend picking out avocados in person at the store if possible, to ensure better quality.

avocado's were past ripe. so gross. unusable. It is very discouraging that this keeps happening when I pay for Walmart if personal shoppers can't tell the difference between ripe and spoiled produce then maybe they should be trained better. now I have to do a return.

I usually love this item but it's either hit or miss the shoppers doesn't not always pick the correct brand when filling the order, they need to be the Has avocados from Mexico. Avocados from anywhere else has a different texture and it's hard to tell if they're ripe or not, plus they take a long time to ripen.

This is the third time that I have purchased avocados already bagged. The first two times, all 6 avocados were good. However, the third purchase was not a good purchase because, first they were not ripe when purchased. Three avocados were good after 3 days of letting them ripen on my kitchen counter. The other 3 were not good at all and were turning black on the inside.

reviews.title: Look great on the outside but rotten on the inside
reviews.review_text: Today is August 11, 2025. These fresh avocados have continuously looked great on the outside, but rotten and moldy on the inside when they become ripe enough to use. This has been an ongoing issue with all varieties of fresh avocados at Walmart for the past several months.

reviews.title: Terrible quality avocados
reviews.review_text: These have been terrible the last times I've ordered them. I started buying them here because I had the same problem with Costco but looks like I'll have to try Costco again. The avocados are either rotten when TI get them, I don't even have to open them, they're super dark and feel hallow when I gently squeeze them. Or other times they're picked way too early and don't ripen correctly leading them to get the dark streaks and nasty flavor when they're finally ripe

reviews.title: Don't Buy -Avoid unusable half- rotten Avocados
reviews.review_text: I have given up in ordering avocados from you. They use to be a great product and I would always order them. But no more, When they arrive in the bag they are hard as a rock. Wait about one week and most are still hard. They start to get a bit soft to touch (tho still hard) and I cut them open and they are unusable -black dark areas and specks throughout the greenish meat. They appear half- rotten. Your vendor is not selling you a guality product!!!! I have talked to several friends who have had the same experience and also will not buy this product from you.

These are watery and taste nothing like the avocados I was getting! But now the are half rotten inside even though they are still hard. The flesh has a watery consistency that I have in 75 years never seen an Alvarado to taste. For probably the last three or four times I bought them I have had to through most of away! They taste bad and I am not buying avocado's from you at all again. I don't know where you are getting them because until recently and I mean at least four bags of them in the last few weeks!

I am not sure where our avacados are now coming from but i dont believe it is Mexico. I received 4 in a bag. 2 avacados were so hard i almost cut my hand trying to cut into them. no matter what i tried to help they never got soft %26 i had to toss while rock hard. the 2 i did make into toast topping were meh %26 flavorless. felt like i threw money away on these. It is August, first week in 2025!

reviews.title: Green, Fleshy, Fibrous
reviews.review_text: It took about a week for these to ripen enough to cut up. They were green, fleshy, and had a good taste but they also came with big fibrous strands within the pulp, which I was not fond of. Overall, made a decent guacamole, but I'll opt for the larger size next time.

reviews.title: Good Value
reviews.review_text: I am pleased with this product. Good value and avocados always nice. Not banged up or overly ripe. The majority of the time they need to ripen. All ripen about the same time so as a single household I share the bag with a neighbor. I will continue to purchase.

None of them were ripe. Took nearly two weeks to ripen with the apple in a bag trick. The downside is now I have to sacrifice an apple. And when they did get somewhat usable over half were going rotten with mold. What a complete joke to go through for some avocados.

reviews.title: I keep buying them, but...
reviews.review_text: I'm going to stop. The avocados are fine while they are useable, but all avocados are at the same stage. None of them are ready at first, then they all ripen the same amount at the same time and you can't use them fast enough. The last couple always go bad and I have to throw them out. I can neither recommend nor not recommend this product. If you can use them up fast enough, it's up to you.

reviews.title: Bad delivery service twice in a row.
reviews.review_text: What the heck?!? I did not get a text telling me my order had arrived, and I checked on line 30 minutes ago and it said preparing. My order sat on my front porch for an hour with frozen food in it. Why no text? It would also be nice if they rang the bell, when they put the last item on the porch. Do I need to switch back to Kroger???

reviews.title: WAY PAST RIPE
reviews.review_text: I received this item (which I have bought numerous times before), by delivery, in unusable condition. They were all WAY past ripe, dark black, so soft I could barely cut one open, and the inside was dark brown (yuck). I tried to get a refund online, but they said the only option was to bring them into the store. I used delivery in the first place because I am unable to go to the store. I am absolutely not keeping rotten avocados for two days until I am able to get to the store!

reviews.title: Avocados are Extremely Healthy
reviews.review_text: After about 2 days sitting out, they are firm but ready to eat and peel off from the pit easily. Definitely prefer these over the larger avocados that are purchased individually. Did you know avocados are extremely healthy for you? Yes, they do have a fair share of calories in them, but the health factor is worth the benefit.

I guess avacados, like most of the produce I have recieved via delivery, are best chosen in person to ensure quality. it seems the shoppers have been trained to select the oldest produce to fill delivery orders. The avocados I have received in ny last two delivery orders were overripe, soft and had brown unusable flesh inside.

reviews.title: Bad avocados.
reviews.review_text: The avocados were hard, which is not unusual. But, I let them sit for a couple days to get a little bit stocked, and when I open them, they were all brown. Since they came in a bag and I ordered them online, I was not able to check them before I got them.

reviews.title: overripe
reviews.review_text: as usual, all the produce i received was overripe and inedible . i swear they do it on purpose on deliveries. thats how they get rid of it. i'm not there to pick it out, so.......they off the rotting produce on me. i call customer service every time and get refunded.

reviews.title: Disappointed in Walmart
reviews.review_text: Yet another example of the disappointment from Walmart . It seems when I order items online that show availability- even give a please substitute if not available- the order somehow gets lost. Items come that were not ordered- and ordered items don't show. Yes , this is most of the time a convenient way to shop, but when this happens over and over with no ownership at the store- it is frustrating

reviews.title: Not good this time
reviews.review_text: I've gotten these before and they were fine but this time something was not right half of the avocado was hard. I was able to cut a good portion of it off but it's like that on all of them in the bag so I'm not sure what's wrong with it but probably will just get individual larger horses i‘ve gotten these before and they were fine but this time something was not right half of the avocado was hard. I was able to cut a good portion of it off but it's like that on all of them in the bag so I'm not sure what's wrong with it but probably will just get individual larger Haas's next time.

reviews.title: Rotten Avocados
reviews.review_text: The entire bag of 6 avocados was black %26 soft upon delivery to my home. I cut them all open and found this rotten mess. (Photo below) I have purchased these in the past a few times and they were ok. This bag AND the previous bag were like this: black %26 rotten. I won't be buying these again.

The delivery was corrwct and everything was fine until I got to the pineapple. The pineapple was visibly shrunken and had an area that appeared to be rotten. i went ahead and peeled it. I was correct qnd the top was rotten and had to cut 3 inches off to get below the rotted top. had to do the same to the bottom. I also had to cut about a third of the pineapple away after it was peeled due to dark bruised rotten parts. Other than the pineapple everything else was fine.

reviews.title: Healthy %26 Delish
reviews.review_text: Having a personal shopper, the ripeness varies. Only once, out of multiple times buying, have I not been thrilled with what I receive. I love both eating plain, or adding to onions, tomatoes, jalapenos and whatever else is on hand. Kitties love them plain. They can also be frozen for future use, rather than purchasing expensive premade guacamole or whatever. 👍🏼 Thank you ALL which make it possible for me to receive these healthy items.

reviews.title: Not Worth It
reviews.review_text: The loose (single) Hass avocados are considerably bigger and if it is not during one of WM's periodic price swings (they were up to a dollar each not too long ago) then they cost just as much as this product, the bagged avocados. Also these did not ripen evenly and one didn't ripen at all. It sat out for 2 weeks and the peel stayed green. Eventually I cut into it and while edible it was extremely firm/tough. I cooked it with a bowl of ramen and it was ok. In any case I most likely will not be buying the bagged avocados at WalMart any more.....unless their singles go up to a dollar again, even then it would be a maybe.

I bought them last shopping trip %26 they were perfect. This time they weren't ripe. It wouldn't have mattered but I needed them for that evening. I left them out for a couple of days %26 they were great! If you order, plan to use them in a few days to be safe

The bag came with 5, but I was only able to use 1. I dont know if these are generically modified, but something was wrong with them. They appeared to be ready byt they werent. Only the outer part was ready and the rest was hard and rubbery. A waste of money! I even let one "go bad", and the outer part was brown/black but the inside looked fresh/ready but it was still hard and rubbery.

reviews.title: Damaged and Overripe Avocado
reviews.review_text: I purchased these avocado a few times in the past and they were so good but in the last two that I brought was mostly black and mushy on the inside when I cut it open. The flesh was clearly overripe, with a bitter smell and dark spots throughout – completely inedible. Really disappointed with the quality. Not sure if it was stored improperly or already bad when shipped to Walmart but I won't be buying avocados from here again.

reviews.title: Lesson learned
reviews.review_text: The avocado bag had very little usable fruit inside it. Even when ripened they were not edible, Brown and hard would be my description. Hopefully someone has gotten some good ones out there but I didn't. I would have asked for refund but not as easy on Walmart.com as it is on Kroger.com. Lesson learned, don't order produce unless I pick it out myself!

reviews.title: Avocado ripening
reviews.review_text: Not close to being ripe when purchased. I purchased a month ago and took one out of the refrigerator to eat. It appeared to be ripe. I could barely cut it . I tried. Could not eat. I had to throw out. I put one in a brown paper bag and sat on the counter. It did ripen after three days. I had to throw two out. One to go. It is on the counter now. I have never had this happen before. They don't want to ripen for me.

reviews.title: When she was good, she was oh so good.
reviews.review_text: More often than not these are rock hard and do not ripen, but instead rot. When they are good, they are good, when they are bad, they are really bad. Think is with Walmart you cab easily get a refund where others even hid the refund links are make them impossible to find.

The label said 5 to 6 avocados there were only four and I've purchased in the past and there's always been five or six Plus, they were all extremely soft and had to be cut open immediately. Unlike in the past, they have been ripening throughout the days.

reviews.title: Avocados
reviews.review_text: Normally Haas Avocados are great. Not sure what happened, 2 of the 5 were uneatable. I normally leave them on the counter or put them in a bag to get ripe. The two never got soft at all. A week after I bought them, they were still rock hard. I cut into them, and they were black, couldn't spoon it out.

reviews.title: Hard as rocks!!!
reviews.review_text: I've bought many that were delicious from Mexico. The last few times, also says from Mexico, but they don't ripen, can't hardly cut open with a sharp knife, too hard to eat. So I've thrown the whole batch away the last few weeks. I'm not going to buy anymore from Walmart for quite some time.

reviews.title: Never received order!!
reviews.review_text: I never received my order. Suppose to be 4-6 window. I called about 6:30. Couldn't talk to anyone. Finally girl told me there was no one coming to deliver orders. Why wasn't I called? No body knew what was going on. At first one girl put me on hold and after 25 mins I hung up. I finally cancelled my order. I tip when they deliver not usually on order form. The next day when I called delivery department and wanted to see if this was going to be the normal way. He hung up on me!! Very bad experience and time. I could not receive an order MAYBE 9. OR UP TO 11:00 pm.

reviews.title: Small Avocados are Great
reviews.review_text: I love the size of these smaller avocados. Many times, I cannot use all of the larger avocado, and despite my efforts to keep the uneaten half looking fresh, it invariably turns brown and unappetizing. These small avocados are great. They will usually take a couple of days to ripen, so I've learned to stagger my purchases.

This particular batch of avocados was picked way too early. I left one out for 3 Days to ripen. They are tart and after 3 days extremely watery which is why they pick them too early. Otherwise, the avocados that I have purchased in the past have been great.

reviews.title: Peruvian Avocados No Bueno
reviews.review_text: Seems like all the avocados at Walmart are coming from Peru these days and 8 out of 10 times they rot on the inside before they ripen. I'm careful not to refrigerate them as I know this stops their ripening process. I tried placing an apple in with them in both a brown bag or a bowl with no luck. If they do actually ripen, they seem to be flavorless and watery. Avocados from Mexico (which they used to carry) were nearly always perfect. My avocado buying from Walmart will stop as long as they are sourced from Peru.

reviews.title: Bad Avocados
reviews.review_text: The last 2 bags I ordered was hard as a rock and bad on inside . I threw all of them away that day. Today the same way. Not blaming anyone except the ones that supply them to you. I cut one . It was hard but it wasn't bad on inside! I threw it away and put the others up to see if the ripen soon. The supplier should know what they are sending you. Thank you

reviews.title: Rotten bag of Avocados
reviews.review_text: I was delivered an entire bag of rotten avocados %26 had to throw them directly away. Couldn't put in for a refund so I lost my money. I won't ever buy the bag again as shoppers don't pay attention to ripeness! I'll only select individual ones %26 hope for better results!!

reviews.title: Non edible
reviews.review_text: I have ordered twice in last few months. The first time they all had tan colored thick fibers in them. I threw them out. Research said they were picked way too soon and the fibers were like blood vessels for the fruit and would not harm a person. The second time when I picked the bag up it oozed fluid. All avocados had sunken spots and non useable. I had to toss. Every time I add a picture it seems it does not get posted. I have decided to stay away from ordering fresh produce. In last few months I have ordered and received non edible strawberries, green beans, tomatoes, lemons, apples, limes and grapes. I really believe the shoppers should be selecting with more care and someone should be removing rotting or spoiled vegies and fruit. I understand mistakes but this has become a constant thing along with missing items. I have been told that returns are easy at any store but I do not drive and transporting spoiled food or returning an item you never received is difficult.

reviews.title: Bad avocado batch
reviews.review_text: I ordered these bags of avocados all the time, and they are usually great. This order every single one of them were severely bruised, even though they were hard to the touch when you cut them open there was less than a teaspoon of avocado that was edible per avocado . The only time I have ever seen this is when they were frozen in transit.

reviews.title: Usually ok !
reviews.review_text: Usually good but as far as curb side pick up . Instead of Walmart employees not putting rotten avocados in my pick up . They put them in my order .Making me have to go in the store and return them after I have done went all the way home and discovered that the avocados were rotten . I would have to say if you wouldn't in the mail don't give them to me . Fairhope Al

reviews.title: Avocadoes that last
reviews.review_text: I have been getting deliveries from Walmart, and I was apprehensive about buying meat or produce, but with the avocadoes I have been getting fresh avocadoes that lasted at least a week. Avocadoes are one of those fruits that it is hard to see if it is rotten because in the outside looks good but once you open them you find out there is no salvage. These avocadoes came out perfect, they were hard, I left them in the bag the shoppers put them in and in about four days I took them out of the bag. Three were ready, one was still hard, but I made avocado/guacamole and it was delicious. I will continue to order them, and a big thanks to the shoppers in my local Walmart. By the way, they were a good size avocadoes.

reviews.title: Great price
reviews.review_text: Overall this is a good deal but it's hit and miss if the product is good and will last more than a day or two. But when they are good they have been great. I continue to buy them because more times than not they are good enough and the price is right

reviews.title: POSITIVE
reviews.review_text: Avocados are so healthy -- I usually have a number of them in my fruit bowl. My experience with these bags has been positive, mostly - sometimes there are ones that don't fully soften. They are affordable, and the right size for me. I purchase often! : )

The Haas Avocados are my favorite. They are the best ones on the market. They make the best guacamole and I love them for eating avocado toast as well. When they are first ripening I love to peel them and cut up and squeeze lemon juice over it or just slice and eat with my food.

reviews.title: Rotten avocados
reviews.review_text: Wow I have bought these avocados 3 different times and they never ripen properly. They go from rock hard to rotten. For being so small, I would think they would ripen in 2-3 days. Like I said they go from rock hard to rotten in 7 - 10 days. Very disappointing.

reviews.title: Produce mgr, Assoc selecting should be fired!
reviews.review_text: The Avocadoes were rotten and moldy. The every one of insides were shades of dark brown and black and liquidy and some had mold growing. Poor management of produce by walmart and even worse associate selection standards. Do the associates know how to evaluate produce for delivery??? These were definitely way past edible in every respect. I like my Avocadoes firm and a bit green so I can ripen them in a paper bag to my desired perfection. I can gently squeeze an Avocado without bruising it to determine ripeness. These Avocadoes were gently squeezable to the seed. Not a good sign! When I cut them open, brown and black, some liquid came out, and fuzzy mold inside and the smell ... gross. I would take pictures but the Avocadoes are already in the trash bin.

reviews.title: Refrigerated ?
reviews.review_text: These Avocados were green and hard However They did not ripen A couple got a little,soft,but started to rot Which tells me that these Avocados must've been refrigerated too long,which prolongs the ripening process, which causes them to rot prematurely when refrigerated too long Whereas,when they are left out to ripen naturally, they will soften by putting off Ethylene Gas just like bananas do

reviews.title: Will try one more time - usually great!!!
reviews.review_text: THESE SHOULD GET 5 STARS…..BUT They have been awesome and great every time I order them. They come green, hard, and in a couple of days they are soft and wonderful…….however, the last two times I have ordered they Deserve 1 star max as they arrived sort of purple brown on outside and hard after a day or so they were softer and when I cut into them they were turning brown inside and had little things that looked like kiwi seeds all in them. I usually love these but if the third time I buy them, I will maybe wait to see if it is the season and try one more time and then I am done if not good.

reviews.title: Rotten avocados
reviews.review_text: I bought this bag of 7 avocados from the Clemson neighborhood market. All 7 of them were ruined and inedible. The picture below is of the last 3. I enjoy doing a pickup but guess I'll need to go inside to guarantee that I get food I can actually eat!

reviews.title: No, I will "NEVER" buy them again!
reviews.review_text: The person who chose these avocados picked the greenest hard ones in the bunch. I put them in a brown paper bag with a banana to ripen them. It did not work. I waited 2 weeks they still didn't turn ripe. So, I looked up if I could cook them, its not suggested, then I bought an apple and tried to stick it in the bag, no didn't work. Third week, I cut one open to my surprise it was hard stingy and BROWN! It was NOT ripe but rotten, how could this be? So, I opened them all in the bag, they all had brown spots and stringy brown strands. Yet were so hard you couldn't eat them. I do not recommed this product at all. Wasted of time and money.

reviews.title: REALLY bad my last two purchases
reviews.review_text: Walmart is my primary store for groceries. Produce from y'all is usually a 3/5 which is to be expected from any grocery store. Unfortunately my last two times buying avocados they were HORRIBLE. Hard at first-which I understand, but as soon as they were soft enough to use they were still very hard in spots, with the rest brown/moldy??? as soon as I cut the m. I LOVE avocado and was very disappointed. I couldn't even eat any of them at all. even my dogs who enjoy them on occasion for a healthy treat wouldn't touch them.

reviews.title: Rotting Produce
reviews.review_text: Delivered to my home. Totally mushy and rotting. The shopper wouldn't buy these! The produce manager is the worst at this store. Most produce is way past its time, or just too small to serve three adults. I buy most fruits and vegetables at Albertsons now.

reviews.title: Eat them quickly b4 going bad
reviews.review_text: I keep them in the bottom drawer of my fridge. Have one out at room temperature that I prefer to eat. One was SO bad, I was only able to eat less than 1/2. Some aren't as bad. Have WM basic dlvry. Maybe get slammed around too much during transport? idk.

the avocados are fine if you go inside snd get them for yourself. if you do delivery or curbside they tend to grab the most ripe, almost too ripe bunch. my last curb side i got 2 bags to keep in fridge they were too past their prime. althey were squishy and very brown on the inside. i was very disappointed and felt like they didnt care what they grabbed. i had to throw them away. i dont like wasting money. So my advice is pick them yourself. The shoppers dont grab the green ones, rhey grab the really dark brown ones.

Whenever I buy avocados, it's kinda hard to tell if they're gonna be well or not when they ripen. This batch of avocados that I got was perfect! They ripened up perfectly in just a few days. There were no brown spots. They look like they came out of a magazine. Thank you so much, WALMART.

reviews.title: I think it's a waste for me.
reviews.review_text: I may as well throw these in the trash when I get them. I really like avocados, so I keep buying these. When I get them, they are a little hard so I can't use them yet. Then I let them ripen until they start to mold. Sometimes I will use one or two before that happens. I have thrown out far more than I've used.

reviews.title: Good deal for some uses
reviews.review_text: I got six for about 55 cents each. Being a single person, the smaller ones are fine but you do have to watch them for when to put in the fridge to stop ripening. It is harder to gauge when they are ripe because they don't get soft like the larger ones do but the stem still pops off when ripe. The one that developed a soft spot was already going bad when cut - small dark cracks in the meat but I still used it. So I can do avocado toast using a whole one, no need to save half of a larger one in the fridge for later. The skins are a bit thinner but the pits are pretty large. I feel that 6 of these are a better deal than 3 of the larger ones unless you need to prep for a big group, then these are going to be a pain.

reviews.title: Avocados won't ripen!
reviews.review_text: They were absolutely horrible. They certainly aren't avocados from Mexico. that Walmart used to carry. This is the second bag that I had issues with most of them never ripened and I had to throw them out. They are tasteless watery and disgusting. I will never buy them again!

reviews.title: No good
reviews.review_text: I always order these and usually never a problem but this time It was a bag of 4 larger ones and they are horrible. They are woody and hard. They are ripe and soft on the outside but so hard and woody closer to the pit, and no flavor at all even after several days of allowing to ripen

reviews.title: I'm so disappointed!!!
reviews.review_text: I've been buying these from you guys for a while. But just like the Cutties I just reviewed the quality has gone down hill big time. These pictures are from a most recent 6 count bag. Judge for yourself. When they are cut open most or all bathe inside is uneatable. Why has the quality of your produce gone down so much. I'm very disappointed in you guys. I'm 72yrs old and on fixed income so when I have to throw away so much food it's a problem.

reviews.title: not useable the 1st day you get them
reviews.review_text: These Avocados are always hard. you have to let them ripen for a couple days. that's the only problem I have with them. they taste good if you don't let them over ripen. some of them are actually dried up and woody looking after you ripen them. not too many times. it is better buy than the single avocados.

Both the Colombian %26 California avocados are rotting quickly. Maybe 1 out of 4 are edible when ripened. For the most part, it's disappointing %26 expensive. I can't return the bad ones because of the quick hot weather decay. Trust me when I say that I wish you would refund 2/4 of the avocados packages I've bought 11 packages in the last 3 weeks ( 5 Colombian - 6 California). Please begin purchasing only Mexican ones.

reviews.title: No good. Overly ripe, mushy and brown spots inside
reviews.review_text: I've purchased these avocados for delivery for a few years now. However in the past serval months, I always received the bags of avocados that are mushy, and have to cut more than half out of each avocado due to them being dark brown and rotten on the inside. I don't let them sit for days either. I use at least one avocado a day every day for my healthier eating. I wanted to give it a chance the past serval times thinking OK this time they won't be mushy or rotten. However I won't order these anymore. I'll be purchasing the same ones at Hyvee. They cost about $1.50 more. However I get to eat the whole avocado instead of just a 1/4 of them. Hyvee must notice the mushy ones and throw them away, instead of setting them out for purchase.. I appreciate them wanting customers happy. I do believe the order pickers pay attention at Hyvee as to whether they are over ripe or not.

I had this smaller variety of avacodos replaced in a pickup order for the large Hass Avocados. I was hopeful they would do the job but they are very small. The pit takes up most of the space with little to no meat on their bones. One alone is barely a snack, much less able to make fresh guacamole with the whole bag.

Surprisingly, these avocados were ripened perfectly upon delivery. It was wonderful that the shopper picked them out so well and I certainly hope it wasn't just a fluke. Most places where I have bought avocados before don't even have them ripe enough to eat until 1-2 weeks after buying them as available for you to pick out in person much less to have delivered and picked by an employee! Cheers!

reviews.title: Dissatisfied
reviews.review_text: Errors with the order I tried to contact to get issued cleared but was unsuccessful. The tomatoes were overripe. I got them 2 days ago and cannot use them today. The organic lettuce is unusable. All 3 heads were full of brown leaves. Could not use. I paid for 3 sweet potatoes and received only one. The last order only a week ago had meat with the use by date the next day. Not the first time that has happened. I am changing stores. Not going to take all those photos. I am just changing stores. You can believe me or not. Your loss

reviews.title: I Don't Recommend Unless You Lack Options.
reviews.review_text: I would not recommend these avocados. Certainly not now at the elevated price point. Thanks, Donnie. Maybe just spend the money on the good stuff. I think one large avocado from a better company is better than a bag of these. But if you are in a pinch, these will do.

reviews.title: Rotten, I cut them open the same day I bought them
reviews.review_text: Everyone of them were rotten inside when I cut them open the same day that I bought them. I live 20 miles from town so I did not even go back to the store to replace them very disappointed with the quality of items that I have received lately when doing walmart pick ups. I should have taken pictures had I realized that I was going to have the opportunity to do a review on them I would have.

reviews.title: Buy a day or so before you need them
reviews.review_text: These guys always arrive before they're fully ripe (rock hard). It's not the worst thing in the world, just something to be aware of if you need them the day you're picking them up/having them delivered. On a very rare occasion, they've been overripe to the point of being rotten when they were delivered. Quality is hit or miss, usually fine after a day or so, but the price is decent for what they aree.

the avacados were hard when i received them. Today i cut them and all of them were bad. none of them could be eaten. I took a picture of them before throwing them in the trash. this is the first time that ive been unhapoy with this product. i would like a refund for the item

reviews.title: BRING BACK AVACADOS FROM MEXICO
reviews.review_text: If I could put NO STARS, I would as this product the last few orders has gone from the bag to the trash within in a day or two and this last order, went from my delivery to my garbage immediately, they were already rotten and the shells cracked open upon touch. They usually come rock hard, then they rot, nothing in-between. Terrible. I understand there are tariffs now from Mexico, but PLEASE quit getting these avocado's from this vendor. I would rather pay 12 bucks a bag from Mexico where I have NEVER had an issue with rotting or quality and get to EAT THEM, than pay more money over several orders and never have a single one be edible for 4 bucks each bag. WASTE

reviews.title: very disappointed in my pick up order of Avocados
reviews.review_text: I always get these every month. I buy anywhere from 20 to 30 bags a month... I am normally very happy with this product.... The Avocados 🥑 are nominally a good value and in good quality but... this time when I bought 8 bags they were in very poor quality and and I was very disappointed... My family of 4 eats at least 1 Avocado a day.... so 8 packs last us about a week. This was a pick up order, so I did not pick these out myself... I don't know if all the Avocados were in this poor quality but it is very disappointing.

reviews.title: Don't trust shopper w/ produce
reviews.review_text: Always expired, I think they have a policy that the shoppers can only shop produce from the trash, Not always. But man it sure does look like it. I am handicapped so I rely on this service. They always give me a refund which is nice, but I still am left without an item.

these avacados looked fine on the outside, I had to wait a day and a half for them to ripen, when I cut into them and peeled them, they looked they had cancer, there were deep black crater's all along tyskin side and around the pit was lined in black. To top it all off they weren't even all the way ripened

reviews.title: SMALL Avocadoes too small/immature
reviews.review_text: Some of these SMALL avocados are too small, take forever to ripen if they ever do. Some are ok, but some are bad. When they don't ripen and I cut them open, they are usually starting to rot. Have had to throw some away. I order them because they're now less expensive, but will go back to ordering the LARGE more mature avocados. Love 'em.

reviews.title: Hass Avocados equals deliciousness
reviews.review_text: I've purchased these delicious Hass avocados for years, I've never been disappointed! They are so delicious and always fresh, ready to eat! I love that I can get them in a bundle because my family adds avocado to pretty much anything and everything during our meals!

reviews.title: 3 over ripe 3 ok bag hope not trend
reviews.review_text: I have to count on the walmart employees to pick the produce for my delivery since I'm recently wheel chair bound. I buy these every week until last week received bad batch with white spots no pictures because this review came 1 week later. I eat one a day luckily I only had to throw one of over ripe the 3 away. Hoping that this is not going to happen in future deliveries.

reviews.title: Overripe, somewhat rotten
reviews.review_text: I got these avocados as part of a pick-up order, so I didn't select them myself. But when i got home, they all turned out to be near-rotten and threw all of them, except one, away. So whichever associate shopped this for me, wasn't paying attention.

reviews.title: Rotten Avocados
reviews.review_text: All five of the avocados in the mesh bag were rotten upon delivery. This produce should have been pulled from the shelves by the produce department quality control standards. Then the order puller chose to put a bag of rotten avocados in my order and then the driver decided to deliver a bag of rotten avocados to my doorstep. Failure at three different levels. Terrible quality control.

I wasn't very happy with it. The last two bags that I have purchased has been completely rotten. I've gotten maybe one out of six they are riding from the inside out. And I bought quite a few bags but here lately the last two bags is been completely rotten. I live away from the store so I haven't complained too much. I just think I won't buy anymore right now till they start getting better thank you.

reviews.title: Rotten Avocados
reviews.review_text: I bought 2 bags and I was able to eat only 1 avocado, and it was questionable. I have bought these before with no issues. I do not know what happened but the avocados would not ripen properly and when they started to ripen they were black inside as if there was some sort of fungus. So basically I systematically had to cut into and throw away all but one.

Half were rotten and the others had white meat. These do not come close to the Haas you carried before. Horrible quality control! Wal Mart obviously decided to go with a cheaper supplier and this is the result. I spoke with the produce manager and she said there was nothing she could do. Told me to return them which I did. I have now returned 3 or 4 bags. They just don't care. Most people will just throw them in the garbage and not return.

reviews.title: Received damaged and rotten avocados
reviews.review_text: Received damaged and rotten avocados two times in a row. Can clearly see the white fungus spots on the avocados skin. How can they send us the spoiled grocery? Paying for Walmart membership and getting all the spoiled stuff delivered to home which should end up in trash. Very frustrating. And to get a new batch of avocados I've to spend $35 to get free delivery with Walmart

reviews.title: hit and miss--mostly miss
reviews.review_text: Out of a bag of 5, 1 was good to eat. The rest, although still very firm and what I would consider unripe, were black inside and went straight to the trash. Bought these for years with wonderful quality and flavor. The last year they aren't fit to eat. I wonder if it's that nasty APPEEL stuff so you can warehouse them too and sell them to us far past the point of fresh. If so, stop it. NOBODY wants that trash.

reviews.title: Avocados rock hard, wont ripped but stay rock hard
reviews.review_text: DELEVERED:🥑🚫The last order they were rock firm, so thought would let them ripped more…. No they stayed rock hard and had little flavor! Do not know what happened in their processing? We're they gassed to force ripping, gone wrong?! We're they frozen to transport, then dehydrated?!! Can not figure out why, and the seeds look abnormal not the brown healthy seed but a pale undeveloped look! Not ripened enough, now won't rippen but instead turn to rot stage fast if taken out of refrigerator! Produce is messed around with too much…. Not everytime but I have lost quite a bite of produce over years from wrong processing or tampered processing! Too many produce getting ruined engulfing the gassing of NUTS!

reviews.title: Horrible avocados
reviews.review_text: These avocados are horrible ! By the time they're soft enough to cut they have brown places all in them and sometimes there are still hard places. They also have stringy things that I've never seen before. I've always gotten these and they've been good except for the last two times.

reviews.title: In love with these
reviews.review_text: We try to always have a bag of these in our home at all times. My mother loves them in a soft bread with salt, pepper and a little vinegar and oil, we enjoy slicing them up with all just mentioned and eating it with a fork for a quick snack, we enjoy making guac with them for a dip with veggie sticks or nacho scoops. I could go on but won't and just say highly recommended!

reviews.title: Usually excellent.
reviews.review_text: I love avocados. When they are in season, I have them every day. I buy the “tiny” ones ( about 2 1/2 -3 ounces prepared.) Walmart has proved to be my most reliable supplier. There have been infrequent times that their shoppers have sent out over-ripe product. Twice they were unusable, but when I notified Walmart they refunded the full purchase price. They always stand behind their produce!

reviews.title: bad bunch
reviews.review_text: These avocados ripened all at the same time, and they had those black spores on the outside, I didn't even have him a couple of days before all that started, and every one of them was rotten inside. I won't be buying them anymore if this last batch that I got looks like it's doing the same

reviews.title: Don't get these delivered!
reviews.review_text: These avos might be fine if you buy them in store, but I've tried having them delivered multiple times and it's been awful. I have yet to have a bag delivered that had more than one or two usable avocados. I don't know of the problem is with the person doing the shopping or with the avocados getting banged up during delivery, but my avocados are always unusable because they're full of black areas where the flesh got exposed to air. Won't buy again.

reviews.title: Avocados , usually good value for the price
reviews.review_text: Quality is variable depending on the shopper. I prefer firm avocados that ripen at home but my last pickup order had overripe avocados that had to be prepared in short order or tossed. I didn't want to make another trip to exchange them so I used them for dip. This was not what I wanted them for. Otherwise, the flavor is usually good.

reviews.title: inconsistent quality
reviews.review_text: you never know what quality of avocados you will get with these packaged avacados. sometimes they're good and usuable, no stress. other times they are watery. and as my most recent bag, they arrive hard as rocks, miss 12hrs-one day of checking em -> next day they are totally mushy and fit for compost. : (

reviews.title: They're very sad excuse for a mini avocado
reviews.review_text: I've bought the mini avocados for a long time and they have been more than satisfactory. Tiny pit and good thick smooth flesh. Now they're small avocados with a medium size pit in them and the flesh is stringy and spotty and the taste is off I've had to throw the last four bags away. They need to check their supplies and get them back on track

reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. POOR QUALITY.
reviews.review_text: These are the worst avocados . This is the second time we've purchased a bag and they've been awful. They were underripe so we left them out a few days to ripen them. After 4 days they still didn't seem ripe. We cut them open and every one was rubbery, hard, and useless. This has happened twice now. One time could be a fluke but two times is one too many. The entire bag was a total waste. I looked up what might cause this and everything I found said this happens when avocados are mass produced and forced to grow quicker. It results in poor quality product. I DO NOT recommend.

reviews.title: The bag was filled with rotten avocados.
reviews.review_text: I ordered these for delivery and received a bag of 5. On the day of delivery, I was forced to trash 4 avocados as they were rotten, mushy with white mold starting to form. Just a glance at the bag was enough to know that the bag was filled with rotten avocados.

reviews.title: Not worth your money
reviews.review_text: These avocados are awful and take ages to ripen. Once the skin is black and “ready to eat” the flesh is still hard, the skin is hollow around it, the flesh sticks to the pit and they taste terrible. I've bought these a few times hoping they'll be better and they never are

These avocados are very good. the ones in this bag are nice because they are small enough to just use one for a salad or a small dip. Some of the ones in the bag are still green and some are black and ready to use, which means they last a pretty good amount of time and do not go bad.

It irritates me very much that my avocado are green and hard as a baseball. Then when I leave them out to ripen. They rot before they ripen. The only explanation I can come up with is that they have been frozen, before delivering them to my house. I only managed to salvage one avocado, after cutting out the bad parts.

for the past 2 months, i have ordered several of bags of these. they go bad before they ripen. the quality has been bad and i have not got to eat them. i tried ripening them differently then i usually do to see if that would do the trick but it doesnt. ive never had problems wirh the. ripening over the years till this summer.

reviews.title: They go from unripe straight to rotten.
reviews.review_text: These avocados never ripened. The last few bags have all turned black before they were even edible. The label said they are from Peru. I have had much better luck with avocados from Mexico. I would prefer to see the country of origin on the website listing so I can choose. Will not be buying these anymore.

That quality on these is absolute garbage. in the last month, I have ordered 8 bags of avocados, and every single bag has been rotten from the inside out. Either the shoppers you have suck at their job, or you intentionally give delivery orders the worst produce in the store, but as bad as these have been, im almost considering a class action just for the sake of everyones health.

reviews.title: Too ripe this time
reviews.review_text: I usually receive semi-ripe avocados which is perfect because they'll last longer, but this order I could only salvage 3 out of the whole bag. The rest were already Brown inside. My shopper missed the mark this time. A refund credit has been issued by Walmart.

reviews.title: Not at this time.
reviews.review_text: I have used this product for over three years. The last two months all three bags I have ordered have had a hard waxy and stringy texture. I am not sure if it the current growing season or some other factor. I will wait to order again for several months.

reviews.title: Very disappointed
reviews.review_text: Very disappointed in quality. Only four small avocados in the bag. All were an unusual texture inside. Even when they felt ripe and were the proper color to be ripe tough texture with black areas. One avocado was so touch and misc black spots and strings inside that I just put it in the trash can. None of them were smooth or creamy.

It was a rotten batch. I cut them open and they were still hard. Everyone had this weird color. Not like an overripe avocado, more like mold. So I cut each one and they were all the same. Now they are usually delicious like normal avocados. First time for everything.

reviews.title: Shopper chose rotten avocado bag
reviews.review_text: Black, rotten, avocado, smashed and leaking from bottom of net bag. This is on the shopper the Walmart shopper. Please do not select rotten or expired food and expect buyer to pay for it! And then to have to jump through hoops to get to return it without coming to the store.

reviews.title: Surprised by rotten avocados
reviews.review_text: If I could submit this item at ZERO stars, I would. I understand how an avocado's internal condition can be deceiving. I've had some hard like a rock and could NEVER ripen. This is the extreme opposite. NO BLAME ON WALMART for this issue, But since these are unusable, will you refund me please?

reviews.title: Only 4
reviews.review_text: The problem with 4 - instead of the usual 6, is that the bigger avocados have bigger seeds. Also, it's a larger serving %26 we all know these brown the second you cut them. It's not as simple as wrapping it up. AND I am not confident this is equivalent in weight - if I am not paying more per lb. Idk why there's only 4???

reviews.title: Very disappointing quality
reviews.review_text: Unfortunately, every avocado in the bag was bad. They were all at varying stages of ripeness, so I let them ripen appropriately and every single one I opened was brown, bruised, or even moldy inside. It's also worth noting that I don't like my avocado avocados super ripe , so I would say I even opened them in the beginning stages of ripeness

reviews.title: Complimentary Feedback
reviews.review_text: I love ordering on line as my health is guarded and I have no or little contact picking my order up at the Pickup Area. Not to forget to mention that all the employees who work at my favorite store are the most polite, considerate and courteous I have had the pleasure of meeting. Always a smile and well wishes, always a kind word and a heartfelt thanks for coming there to pickup my orders. Never a long wait in line, I am notified when my order has been completed, I give notice that I am on my way, I then text them which parking space I am in and the color if my car , the wait is minimal usually only minutes. I have unlocked my trunk and they politely ask where I would like my groceries placed, in my trunk and they always pack them with care. I try to catch them before they hurry to get their next order to deliver to get their names so I can leave feedback so Walmart knows what a joyous time I have picking up my online order at the pickup area. I want them to know how wonderful their employees are and how courteous and polite they are. Your Human Resources have done a marvelous job complying a team that is so very kind and whom I can hardly wait to remind them of this in my feedback always including my delivery persons name to give credit where credit is due. They always lift my spirits each time I pickup my orders. Kudos for making my day better each time I come to get my orders! Thank you so very much as I am indeed grateful and feel blessed every time!

reviews.title: Too ripe!
reviews.review_text: I've been using pick up for over 2 years. I must get a ride to town so this works well for me, once a month. In the past the 2 bags of avocados are mostly hard which works well as I can ripen them 1-2 at a time. This month both bags were ripe or several over ripe. Great if you're having a party but I'm only one person. I refrigerated them however, I ended up making a lot of guacamole and shared with friends. Fun but not economic for me! Wish there was a way to let the shoppers know exactly what you're needing. Overall, this is the only negative issue I've had with Walmart pick up!

reviews.title: I love avocadoes!
reviews.review_text: The bag contains 5 - 6 avocadoes, and each one is a perfect size for a serving for one person. I have found that the avocadoes in the bag generally do not have bruises on them from being squeezed to test for ripeness, unlike the individual ones that people pick up and test for softness. They have good, satisfying flavor whether eaten by themselves or in a salad or on a sandwich. I believe they are a very good value.

reviews.title: I don't know what these are but…..
reviews.review_text: I don't know where this came from but these are not avocados. I'm never in my life out of all my years ever come across anything like this I have had them for a month and they are still as hard as a rock like rubber I need to get my money back this is disgusting not edible. Do not buy.

I Love these little gems. I use them for healthy fat in my daily diet. I sometimes recieve unripened and I prefer over being too ripe. I just put a few in a paper sack with an apple and they ripen right away. I only use 1 a day, that why I prefer only ripening a few at a time. the flavor and texture is spot on. my favorit is served on toast with a poached egg or with tomato and basil. But there are times when I just cut in half and grab a spoon for quick snack. Cant beat the healthy fats.

reviews.title: So far my store always provides good avocados
reviews.review_text: So far my store has always provided me with good, fresh avocados. This particular bag has smaller sized avocados, so just know that. The seeds inside are always a mystery. The last bag I received had tiny seeds with plenty avocado meat EXCEPT for one of the avocados from the same bag had a HUGE seed and less avocado meat. You just never know, fruit is always unpredictable.

reviews.title: Rubber texture, not ripe after 3 weeks
reviews.review_text: I just want to know why I've had these for 3 weeks and I still can't eat them. They're not even close to being ripe. I cut the avocado and the meat is like rubber. I would cut a slice and bend it and it wouldn't even break, not normal at all. It even still smells like grass like the ground, you can tell it's not ripe but avocados go ripe after 2-3 days not 2-3 weeks… It's weird, this has never happened to me before. Now I have to go to a different store and physically buy the avocados. I wish I took pictures before tossing them out.

I love avocados. This bag is typically ready to use within a day but there is the off chance that you get super unripe avocados and have to wait days for that addition to your eggs but in also an at home delivery princess. If I actually went into a store I'm sure I would find ripe product.

reviews.title: Beware if you have them delivered
reviews.review_text: I had a delivery order from the store and unfortunately I got rotten cucumbers along with rotten avocados and sprouted potatoes. And even with taking pictures, they don't replace the rotten produce they picked out. You have to go to the store and wait in their return line. So since that defeats the point of having it delivered, and this has happened a few times, I don't see myself ordering from them anymore. Bummer.

reviews.title: No Guac Today...
reviews.review_text: This is the second batch of small Haas avocados I've purchased in the past 1-2 months, and I've been disappointed with both. The problem? They arrive "rock"-hard, and never ripen correctly. In both instances I placed the eight (8) avocados inside a paper bag, rolled-up the top, and left the bag outside on my front porch (I also put a red apple inside the second bag); it was warm, South Florida weather. By the time the avocados in the first bag were soft enough to cut, the insides were mushy-to-rotten; after four days, the avocados in the second bag remain "rock"-hard. This only happens with Haas avocados; it's never happened with other varieties. "Let the buyer beware!"

reviews.title: Rotted avocados
reviews.review_text: The avocados I received were completed rotted. I have no idea how the shopper thought it was a good idea to pick those specific rotted ones. They were black, moldy and as soon as you touched them they sank in to a mushy mess. Gross to say the least. The shopper was clearly not paying attention and did not care. Unfortunately a few more of my items were in similar state. I guess I just got bad luck with a careless shopper for my delivery. Walmart refunded my items though so that was good but I was still out of my items that I had ordered and needed at that moment.

reviews.title: bad pickers
reviews.review_text: this is the first time i have gotten my avocados picked by an associate and arrived bad and beat up and i cut them open and most were mostly dark inside. 2 were good to eat others i had to throw away. And i mentioned this on my messages prior from order being started to please choose good fruits and veggies

reviews.title: Size is perfect
reviews.review_text: I buy these often and love them. The small size is perfect for single use. In a small household that means no waste. I put them in the fridge and take one out at a time to fully ripped and they last well. Usually do not arrive ripe, which I like, but could be a problem for others that want to use them when they arrive. Todays order a few were pretty ripe, which was a disappointment to me as I'll have to use them fast and will probably lose a couple cuz putting them in the fridge ripe they overripe or rot fast. But overall good consistent choice. May try to add a message when ordering if possible to not select ripe ones?

reviews.title: Inconsistent Ripeness Lately
reviews.review_text: Good flavor when perfect, but hard to catch at the right time. These small Hass avocados can be hit or miss. When they're right, they're buttery and smooth, just like you'd hope, but lately they've been inconsistent — either too ripe and starting to brown or rock hard and never softening properly. It's frustrating because the flavor is great when you get a good batch, but it's become tough to find that sweet spot. Helpful Insight: Store them in a paper bag with a banana for a day or two — it helps stubborn avocados ripen more evenly.

reviews.title: Filling orders needs improvement. Many items left
reviews.review_text: This is not for the avocados. However, too much of fruits and vegetables are beginning to rot. I do not drive so I can't go exchange them. The number one complaint is leaving up to half of my order out. Instead of delivering what you left out...normal groceries.. I have to go thru corporate office!! Also, there is no order list included so I cannot see what was left out! This time, two places of bread! Lots of improvements needed at Twin City!Fil!ing

reviews.title: Creamy goodness in these Avocados!
reviews.review_text: I always bought my avocadoes from the loose bin, but one day, all of those looked hard as a rock. So I tried these in the green mesh bag. Bingo! They were a good size - though not as large as the individual ones in the bin - but plenty big enough. We should all be eating an avocado or a half avocado a day to be healthy. This bag helps me achieve that goal, and I usually need only one bag a week.

reviews.title: No guacamole tonight!
reviews.review_text: Even when I pick out avocados myself, I sometimes buy a bad one. A "store picker" doesn't have time to feel each avocado in a bag when filling the order. I like the smaller avacados in a bag. In the past, they've been better than the large avocados. This time (and I think there were about 8 or 9 in the bag, I could use only 1/2 of 1 avocado! All the rest had many black spots in them. My lesson: pick avocados myself.

reviews.title: MY Avocados
reviews.review_text: My avocados came along with everything else and everything else was wonderful and the service to the door was wonderful. However, I avocados that were picked were so ripe that they were rotten inside. That's my only issue. I would like to be credited for those as I am having to throw them away Please and thank you.

They were hard and green which when I received others they were not very hard and not a bright green they never got ripe they just stayed hard and then turned brown when you cut them they were rotten all 6 were no good I have had others and it never happened like this very disappointed.

reviews.title: I would not buy these again overripe
reviews.review_text: I was extremely disappointed when I received my avocados. They were overripe squishy, and when I opened each one, they had a very bad smell. It would be nice if the shopper would notice when an item is overripe. I will not buy bagged avocados again. It was not worth the money, and I had to forget making guacamole for Cinco de Mayo.

I love these avocados because of their size. I never eat a full sized one because they always start turning brown no matter how I store them. With these small ones I can eat the entire avocado. They are always fresh. Sometimes a little under riped but they ripen up quickly on my kitchen counter.

last week before last they were hard when i cut them to eat i could not get it out of the rind or cut up they were not right so i ordered a nother one they are ok but fir sime reason alittle hard to cut i do not know whst has happened to them they were both a week or more old i will be ordering again after the 1st i still have one more and if the nexted ones are that way i will not order them again for a while, other wise i have been very happy with my service except for the times they took my orders back because the person could not speak ENGLISH,

The whole bag was mushy, unable to use. I would much rather be told "out of item" than to have to pay for item that is not usable. If an employee does not know how to determine if an item is bad, the produce staff should have cleared them out. Now I have to pay for their mistake.

reviews.title: I have never seen anything so absurd
reviews.review_text: It's disheartening to witness such a stark decline in the quality of produce I've come to expect. For years, your avocados have been a reliable staple. However, the shipment I received today is an unacceptable affront to any reasonable standard. To call these avocados "small" is a gross understatement; they are laughably diminutive, with one specimen barely eclipsing half the size of a golf ball. Extracting even a meager amount of flesh from such pitiful fruit is a futile endeavor. Frankly, the arrival of such substandard goods suggests a severe lapse in Walmart's quality control. It appears your procurement standards have plummeted, allowing suppliers to offload produce that should never reach your shelves. More concerning is the apparent dereliction of duty within the produce department itself. A competent manager or designated staff member would conduct daily inspections, diligently removing overripe or otherwise inferior items. Instead, it seems your home delivery pickers are left to contend with whatever substandard inventory languishes on the shelves. As a former food and produce buyer, I can unequivocally state that the quality control at this particular store is alarmingly close to non-existent. This isn't a minor oversight; it's a systemic failure that disrespects your customers and devalues the trust we place in your brand. This situation demands immediate attention and a commitment to restoring the quality standards that once made your produce section a reliable choice. I refuse to pay for this unacceptable shipment and expect a swift resolution to this deeply concerning issue. Additionally, there were three other produce items I had ordered, and each of them was largely substandard due to half of the fruit items in the bag being so ripe one could literally put the finger directly through it.
